page.title: 15Guide Dog Training,Leam Spa.
page.content: Puppy Walkers When the breed bitch dog has babies the guide dog owners wait until the pups are six weeks old then they are fostered into suitable homes. Here they learn to cope with town life. The people who foster the pups take them to different places, railway stations, shops etc. They are fostered for one year. Next the pups spend one month with their future owner.Then the pups are trained. They then have an obedience test.Trainers tell the dog to sit, stand and heel. Between 5+8 months training the dog meets it's future owner. When a breed bitch has a litter of pups the pups names all begin with the same letter. It costs Â£1000 to train one guide dog. All the money is donated by charities or by the collection of silver foil.
